utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Jenny?

utterance.speaker: JENNY RYAN
utterance.content: Kate, thank God. Um, have … have you heard from Kevin?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I haven’t. Have you?

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: No, I’ve been calling him to test our system and he’s not answering and I’m freaking out a little bit. Um … do you have any idea where he is?

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Kate? Kate, are you there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, I’m here.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: What’s going on? Where’s Kevin?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jenny, I need you to stay calm. Okay? Something’s happened.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: A crime scene at a fire? Never done one of these before.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: After this you might not want to. Building was being rehabbed so the place was supposed to be empty. Guess our victim didn’t get that memo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do we know who our victim is?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, n- Oh, oh, oh. Oh my God. Oh my God, it’s Jenny. It’s go time. Hi, Jenny. Are you having contractions? Are you – – oh. No, no, it’s good to double check if my phone’s working. Or triple check. Okay. All right, sweetie. Talk to you soon. False alarm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is she, two days past her due date?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Three. So it could happen at any minute. Can you believe it? Me as a dad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh Ryan, you’re gonna be great.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You guys pick a name?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, we couldn’t agree on one. So we’re waiting to see if it’s a boy or a girl, then decide.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: May I suggest … Cosmo.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No you may not. And rather than pick a name for my kid, you should pick a date for your wedding.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pick a date for my wedding? I was planning on bringing her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? When is that? I might have plans.

utterance.speaker: MARK KIMBALL
utterance.content: Hey. I’m Mark Kimball, building and safety. You guys really need to be in here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s where our crime scene is.

utterance.speaker: KIMBALL
utterance.content: Ah, well, don’t stay any longer than you have to. Fire did structural damage. I need to clear the building.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We should be in and out.

utterance.speaker: KIMBALL
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So do we know who the victim is?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nope. Dude had a wallet, but it was burned to a crisp. Even if he was a dude. It’s hard to tell that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I see what you mean.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Actually, he is a dude, which is about all I could tell you right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that a bullet hole?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Probably a 9, so needless to say this wasn’t from natural causes.

utterance.speaker: DELIA BURTON
utterance.content: Neither was the fire.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This is Lieutenant Delia Burton. She’s the fire investigator with the FDNY. Detective Beckett, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nice to meet you. So, this was arson?

utterance.speaker: BURTON
utterance.content: Well, it’s looking that way. I found miniscule traces of accelerants at the flash point.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the killer set the fire to cover up the murder?

utterance.speaker: BURTON
utterance.content: Except there’s no accelerant on the body. And the fire’s flash point is deep in the building. You know, normally when you’re disposing of a body you’re going to make sure it burns.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So maybe our victim surprised the arsonist –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And the arsonist killed him, silencing the witness.

utterance.speaker: BURTON
utterance.content: That’s how it looks to me. Then again, homicide’s not my specialty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but fire is. Would you mind keeping me in the loop unless you find anything else?

utterance.speaker: BURTON
utterance.content: Sure. As soon as I know what happened, so will you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: BURTON
utterance.content: The building. You guys should probably go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds good. See ya!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m … marrying … him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Um … why don’t we just look into whoever owns this place. See if they know who might have been in here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: ART TORINO
utterance.content: I have no idea who he is. Wasn’t nobody supposed to be in there on account of the renovation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: TORINO
utterance.content: Maybe the guy was a bum or a squatter or something. But hey, you know, human life, still a tragedy, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Torino, let’s talk about why no one was there, not even a security guard. Wasn’t your building basically abandoned after you stopped renovations three months ago?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Due to a cash flow problem?

utterance.speaker: TORINO
utterance.content: Who are you again?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just someone who couldn’t help but notice your bank required a high level of insurance on that building as a condition of granting you the loan.

utterance.speaker: TORINO
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So a total loss insurance claim would solve all of your cash flow problems.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. The downside being, you’ll go to prison for murder.

utterance.speaker: TORINO
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? I wouldn’t burn down my own building, okay? Somebody else must have done it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tell me this, Mr. Torino, are you involved in organized crime?

utterance.speaker: TORINO
utterance.content: I take offense to that. Just because I’m Italian I’m in the mob?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I think you are in the mob because you area known member of the Minari crime family and you also have convictions in racketeering, assault, fraud –

utterance.speaker: TORINO
utterance.content: Yeah, okay. Okay. I moved on. I’m out of the life now. It was my dream to rehab that building a flip it and retire to Boca. Now that dream? It’s up in smoke.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So Art Torino’s alibi checks out. He was at the Pink Palace Gentlemen’s Club last night, stuffing g-strings from 8PM to 4AM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but that doesn’t mean he’s in the clear. I mean, Torino wouldn’t do this himself.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll see if anyone he’s been hanging with has any connection to arson.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll grab Castle. We’ll see if Lanie’s got anything new on our vic.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Still no ID and he’s not in any missing persons report.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We get a match on the bullet?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s not in the system, but the cause of death was definitely a GSW to the head. No smoke in the lungs, so he was already dead when the fire got going.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beats getting roasted alive.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m right there with you. Also, he was healthy, muscular, his teeth were in good shape, so he probably wasn’t homeless. Plus he had great medical care.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How can you tell?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He had a fractured leg that was splinted with metal plates and screws. Quality work, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can the plate be traced?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m already on it.

utterance.speaker: BURTON
utterance.content: Was it the left leg? Anterior femur, midway down.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That’s right. How did you know?

utterance.speaker: BURTON
utterance.content: I know who he is. He’s a fire investigator names Blake McCann. He was my partner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I got it, Lanie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So dental records confirm that our victim is Blake McCann.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m very sorry.

utterance.speaker: BURTON
utterance.content: He was a good man. Most decent person I ever knew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know anyone in his life that would have wanted to hurt him?

utterance.speaker: BURTON
utterance.content: Just the person who left this. I found it at the fire scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: BURTON
utterance.content: This pattern is made by accelerant. From the staining pattern, probably benzoyl peroxide, squeezed from a tube. Blake found the same pattern in ten other burned buildings.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So it’s a signature?

utterance.speaker: BURTON
utterance.content: Of a serial arsonist. Blake has been hunting this guy for years. It’s how he spent every spare minute. In fact, he had just taken some vacation days to work the case. When I found this symbol I called him. He didn’t call me back. I, uh … I just had an awful feeling.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he know who the arsonist is? Did he have any suspects.

utterance.speaker: BURTON
utterance.content: Not that he ever told me. He just called him The Phantom, because he seemed to be able to slip in and out of buildings without people ever noticing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Until now, maybe.

utterance.speaker: BURTON
utterance.content: Well that’s gotta be it, right? I mean, Blake went in that building because he was after the guy. And that’s who killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s too soon to know, but it’s a place to start. Now, we’re going to need copies of his case files linked to the arsonist.

utterance.speaker: BURTON
utterance.content: Well, he took a bunch of them home with him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll have detectives pick them up.

utterance.speaker: BURTON
utterance.content: The rest are at the office. I’ll get them over to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, I talked to Blake McCann’s coworkers, his ex-wife, and if he’s got any enemies I’m not finding them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Leaving us with The Phantom.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you please not call him that? It just – it sounds silly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sillier than the arsonist, which starts with ‘arse’? At least with The Phantom he’s got some mystique.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He doesn’t deserve mystique. He’s a killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but killing is not a part of his usual MO. Until now all the building he torched were empty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, all right. So what else do they have in common?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not much. All the buildings were older, but some were residential, some were office buildings. There were two in Manhattan, and the rest in Brooklyn and in Queens.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were they insured?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A couple of them, but not all of them, so it probably was not arson for hire.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means he’s doing this for himself. He’s burning these buildings to satisfy an inner need. And like a serial killer, there’s a reason why he chooses the buildings he does. There’s a patterns or something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An entry from three days ago. McCann wrote down a name. Ferguson.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Clear.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Clear.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’d say someone besides us is interested in Blake McCann.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Looks like this place was tossed after he was killed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You thinking what I’m thinking?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That the arsonist shot him and then got word that McCann left a paper trail.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He came here searching for any files or evidence that would point to him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe our perp tossed the place because he couldn’t find them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But McCann had no reason to hide those files. They’d be out on a table, a desk, or a nightstand. Wait. McCann’s car. It wasn’t in the driveway.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or in the garage.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He probably drove it to that building before he was killed. It still could be down there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. With those files in it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here it is. Adam Ferguson. Blake McCann helped put him away on multiple arson counts. He got out of prison five years ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which, by wild coincidence, it about the same time those buildings started getting torched.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not only that, but check this out. Look at who Blake called on his cell the day before he was killed.

utterance.speaker: ADAM FERGUSON
utterance.content: Yeah, McCann called me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To talk about what?

utterance.speaker: FERGUSON
utterance.content: Just a chat between friends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night between 9 and 1AM, Mr. Ferguson?

utterance.speaker: FERGUSON
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because he was murdered by an arsonist he was hunting.

utterance.speaker: FERGUSON
utterance.content: Well that’s a real shame.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An arsonist not unlike yourself. Matter of fact, one of his final acts was to write down your name.

utterance.speaker: FERGUSON
utterance.content: Not because I killed him. It must have The Phantom. I don’t know his real name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How do you know about him at all?

utterance.speaker: FERGUSON
utterance.content: Blake told me. He called me. Asked me to meet him in some deli in the Village. He was all startled up about catching this Phantom guy. He asked for my help and I said I’d give it to him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Even though he put you in prison?

utterance.speaker: FERGUSON
utterance.content: Blake paid me for my time. Plus, uh … .. he let me see some of the photos of the fires. So we both got something out of the deal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what other wisdom did you offer him?

utterance.speaker: FERGUSON
utterance.content: Any idiot can slosh gas around and light a match. But this guy, he knew fire. Knew how it spread. See, fires are just like people. There’s a weak spot. The soft underbelly. He would find it. Use it. Unleash an inferno with barely any accelerant. That … is an artist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how did any of this help McCann?

utterance.speaker: FERGUSON
utterance.content: I gave him some tips. I told him he was looking for someone who cases, builds things carefully. Visits them a few times before he strikes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What else?

utterance.speaker: FERGUSON
utterance.content: An artist like The Phantom? He wants to admire his work. It’s not enough that he sets the fire. He needs to feel the heat, to listen to the music. The roar of the flames, the moans of the buildings as they give in? That’s what he lives for. Which is why, with every fire he sets, he is there watching.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: What do you make of his story?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The staff of the deli where he said he met McCann remembers seeing them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s no way to really know what they talked about. McCann could have accused him of being The Phantom.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Maybe he is The Phantom.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We don’t have anything that links him to any of the arsons yet, so …

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Dig into his alibi and associates. See if you can get anything that’s solid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, one thing about his story that does ring true on a character level is about how the arsonist watches his own fires.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, I’ve got unis canvassing the fire scene and checking into all the security cameras in the area for anyone who was hanging out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Found McCann’s car. It was parked two blocks from the fire and there was something inside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Arson files?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, it looks like it was several files he put together himself. One was about the building he was burned up in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s the other one?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Give me that. It’s an old shoe factory in Brooklyn on Arcadia Lane. It looks like it’s been empty for five years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, maybe those files were on buildings that McCann thought were being targeted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was right about one of them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, Espo, we believe that the arsonist cases the buildings the burns. So check that factory and see if anyone suspicious has been seen inside.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re on it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Man. Look at this place. Fire would be an improvement.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It looks like no one’s set foot in here in years.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s pretty creepy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Trust me, bro. Your ringer is all the way up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I just want to make sure. Jenny might call me at any minute.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Pulling your phone out isn’t going to make it happen any sooner. You just need to chill.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And you know this from your vast experience of having zero kids?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, you know what? You’re all emotional right now so I’m going to let that go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, let’s get back. There’s nothing to see here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa, wait a minute. Abandoned building with a brand new lock?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD, anybody here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All clear.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Clear.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Javi, those are blasting caps here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And accelerants up the wazoo. Look.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This isn’t the arsonist’s next target. It’s his workshop.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We must have set off an alarm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s not an alarm. Get out. Get out now!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I checked the security cameras near the fire. They were disabled.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Disabled how?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone used a can of spray paint mounted on a pole and blacked out the lenses of both cameras just minutes before the fire.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That must have been the arsonist. Maybe somebody saw them do it. Can we canvass the area? And by ‘we’ I mean obviously somebody else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you looking for? And don’t tell me, it’s something completely inappropriate for the workplace.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, not this time. Given that everyone uploads everything to the internet nowadays I thought I might see if anyone else took a video of that fire, and look. If the arsonist was watching that fire he might be in this video.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you turn up the sound?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That doesn’t look right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously? A lot better quality than the security camera.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, babe, I’m talking about the building. That fire just started.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The fire department’s not even there. I mean, they’re not on their way. You can’t hear the sirens.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So how did the cameraman know there was a fire when no one else did?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And listen to that. He’s not yelling for anyone to call 911. He’s not saying anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look at the camera work. Very smooth, steady. You – you don’t think –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I do. This isn’t just footage of the fire. It was shot by the arsonist. We have to track down whoever posted that video.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Got you.

utterance.speaker: TECH AGENT TORI
utterance.content: That won’t be so easy. Usually there’s a file embedded in the video with data on the camera, but it’s been stripped out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you tell where it was uploaded?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: Let me see. Looks like the video got bounced around the net from site to site. But this is where it started.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pyrolicious.com. Really?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: Wow. Okay. A site that caters to fire fetishists.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I didn’t even know there was a fire fetish.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The actual term is pyrophilia, for the proof that the internet has something for everyone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not going to ask how you knew that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So when did this video show up there?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: About an hour after the fire was put out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who runs the site?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: It’s registered to a Milo Pavlik.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does he have a record?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: Oh yeah. He burnt down his family’s house when he was 19.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where do we find this Milo Pavlik?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Milo Pavlik, NYPD! Open up!

utterance.speaker: MILO PAVLIK
utterance.content: What? Hi – – hey, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where did this video come from?
